history.content: I took 152 last spring and I'd classify it as an interested but unnecessary class for someone interested in CS systems (more necessary if you really want to get into computer architecture research). I haven't found much use for the 152 concepts in other classes (even CS 162) or in general, but I still found the class interesting and Krste is great! I'd say 161 is far more important than 152, but keep in mind that 152 is only taught in the spring.

I took 152 last spring and I'd classify it as an interested but unnecessary class for someone interested in CS systems. I haven't found much use for the 152 concepts in other classes (even CS 162) or in general, but I still found the class interesting and Krste is great! I'd say 161 is far more important than 152, but keep in mind that 152 is only taught in the spring.

Can anyone comment on how important it is to learn 152 for a person who is interested in CS systems? I took 162 and 186 and really enjoyed learning to build different systems. 

I would like to take 164, 161, 127 next semester, but I was wondering if 152 is more important to take than 164 early on (also 164 is taught by Hilfinger next semester...). I am planning to take both eventually, but I cannot decide which to take first.

Any advice will be greatly appreciated!
history.subject: importance of 152
